newsitem.title: USA: Computer Associates sees revs below estimates.
newsitem.headline: Computer Associates sees revs below estimates.

text.p: Computer Associates International Inc, citing softness in the European market, said Thursday it expects its revenues for the third quarter ending December 31 to come in below Wall Street estimates.
The company said it expects to post revenues of between $1 billion and $1.1 billion, rather than the consensus estimate of $1.2 billion.
Despite the revenues projection, the company said in a statement that consensus estimates of $0.75 per share for the quarter "appeared achievable."

"We are disappointed that European revenues are coming in lower than expected this quarter," Computer Associates President and Chief Operating Officer Sanjay Kumar said in a statement. Kumar said in a statement the company's transition to "new client/server platform opportunities" has been going smoother in North America than in Europe.

"We have to continue to do a better job of near-term execution in Europe and we have taken the appropriate actions to support our European business through this transition," he added. The company said it expects to issue the quarter's results on January 21 after the close of the stock market.
